oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Diary of Sarah Frances M. Ring
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Ring family of Franklin, Tenn., provided three of their four sons to the Army in WWI. The third oldest, Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div., was killed in Oct., 1918. In the early 1930s the War Department offered trips to widows and mothers to visit the cemeteries in Europe. Sarah Ring made the pilgrimage in 1933 and kept this diary of her trip. The front of the diary includes images of flags and information about ship travel. She documents the sites she visited while in France.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
